input:

17:31 Event: Shots on target by Real Madrid
17:47 Caption: Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous low effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Diego Alves, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
18:00 Event: Ball out of play
18:06 Event: Throw-in by Real Madrid

20:42 Caption: This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Daniel Parejo (Valencia) was quite harsh and Jesus Gil Manzano didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
21:08 Event: Direct free-kick by Real Madrid
21:08 Event: Ball out of play
21:17 Caption: Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) failed to convert a long-range free kick and sends the ball narrowly over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Valencia will have a goal kick.
21:28 Event: Clearance by Valencia
22:00 Event: Ball out of play
22:07 Event: Throw-in by Valencia
22:38 Event: Foul by Real Madrid

23:55 Event: Ball out of play
23:59 Event: Throw-in by Real Madrid

24:18 Event: Yellow card by Valencia

25:11 Event: Direct free-kick by Real Madrid
25:13 Event: Ball out of play

26:52 Caption: Goal! Daniel Carvajal clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid), who jumps highest and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the bottom left corner. Diego Alves had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.

29:46 Caption: Daniel Parejo (Valencia) sends in a poor cross from the corner and Keylor Navas has no trouble gathering it.

43:57 Caption: Munir El Haddadi (Valencia) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Real Madrid.
44:08 Event: Clearance by Real Madrid
44:59 Caption: The first half of today's match has just finished.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Valencia
00:01 Caption: Everything is set for the start of the second half.
01:10 Event: Foul by Real Madrid
02:12 Event: Ball out of play
02:24 Event: Throw-in by Real Madrid
03:28 Caption: Toni Kroos (Real Madrid) collects an inch-perfect pass and strikes the ball from far out, but his shot is blocked.
03:56 Caption: Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) unleashed a monstrous piledriver. He controlled a pass, glanced up at goal and shot from the edge of the box. It could have been a difficult one for the keeper, but the ball fortunately hit one of the defenders and ball bounced away.
04:13 Event: Foul by Valencia
05:52 Event: Foul by Real Madrid

07:03 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia
07:07 Event: Shots off target by Valencia

08:28 Event: Ball out of play
08:30 Event: Throw-in by Real Madrid
09:11 Caption: Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) takes a good first touch just outside the box and unloads a shot without any hesitation that bounces off the right post. Not a bad try.
09:20 Event: Foul by Valencia
09:46 Caption: Daniel Parejo (Valencia) was too forceful with his tackle and Jesus Gil Manzano interrupted the game to signal a free kick. The referee points to the penalty spot. Real Madrid are awarded a penalty kick!
10:30 Event: Yellow card by Valencia
10:47 Caption: Ezequiel Garay (Valencia) receives a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee.
10:57 Caption: Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
11:03 Event: Penalty by Real Madrid
11:23 Caption: Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the bottom right corner, but Diego Alves pulls off a superb save.
11:55 Event: Shots off target by Real Madrid
12:24 Event: Clearance by Valencia
12:37 Event: Ball out of play
12:43 Caption: CLOSE! James Rodriguez (Real Madrid) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that whistles over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Valencia.
12:48 Event: Throw-in by Valencia
14:25 Caption: The attendance for today's match is 75180.
15:53 Caption: James Rodriguez (Real Madrid) commits a foul and Jesus Gil Manzano immediately signals a free kick.
15:54 Event: Ball out of play

17:40 Caption: What a chance that is! Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Valencia.

18:43 Caption: The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Eliaquim Mangala (Valencia) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
19:36 Caption: The free kick will be taken by James Rodriguez (Real Madrid).
19:46 Event: Direct free-kick by Real Madrid
19:46 Event: Shots off target by Real Madrid
20:15 Event: Foul by Real Madrid
20:15 Caption: James Rodriguez (Real Madrid) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box, but it's blocked by the players standing in the wall, saving the goalkeeper a lot of effort.
20:40 Caption: Here is a change. James Rodriguez is going off and Zinedine Zidane gives the last tactical orders to Marco Asensio (Real Madrid).
20:42 Event: Substitution by Real Madrid
21:02 Event: Ball out of play
21:07 Event: Throw-in by Valencia
21:22 Event: Ball out of play
21:29 Event: Throw-in by Real Madrid

24:17 Event: Throw-in by Valencia

25:11 Caption: Good chance for Rodrigo (Valencia) as he latched on to a cross on the edge of the box and blasted the ball towards the net! It flew wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Real Madrid.
25:14 Event: Clearance by Real Madrid
26:32 Event: Substitution by Real Madrid
26:43 Caption: Zinedine Zidane has decided to substitute Karim Benzema and he is replaced by Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid).
27:15 Event: Ball out of play

31:16 Event: Foul by Real Madrid

31:43 Caption: Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid) has tested the patience of referee Jesus Gil Manzano and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
32:47 Event: Shots off target by Real Madrid
33:32 Caption: Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) meets a cross inside the box and heads it goalwards. Unfortunately for him, he sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a chance! The ball goes out of play and Valencia will have a goal kick.
34:13 Event: Clearance by Valencia
34:14 Caption: Antonio Latorre (Valencia) is clearly asking for some medical attention with his painful gestures. The extent of his injury is yet to be discovered.
34:27 Caption: The game is interrupted now, Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) picks up a knock and the physio has to come on.
34:35 Caption: Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) has picked up a minor injury, but it looks like he will be able to continue.
34:45 Caption: Antonio Latorre Grueso (Valencia) is moving okay again after that injury scare.
35:15 Event: Foul by Real Madrid
35:56 Caption: Poor challenge! Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid) is penalised for tripping and Jesus Gil Manzano blows his whistle. Valencia are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
36:01 Event: Yellow card by Real Madrid
36:21 Caption: Luka Modric (Real Madrid) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
36:28 Caption: Daniel Parejo (Valencia) sets the ball up and is ready to take the free kick from a promising distance. Many goals have been scored from this distance. Let's see what happens.
36:41 Event: Direct free-kick by Valencia
36:42 Event: Goal by Valencia
36:50 Caption: Daniel Parejo (Valencia) scores a glorious goal after converting the long-range free kick by hammering the ball into the top left corner!
37:50 Event: Kick-off by Real Madrid
39:30 Event: Ball out of play
40:05 Caption: Jose Gaya (Valencia) comes onto the pitch after Antonio Latorre Grueso signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
40:08 Event: Substitution by Valencia
40:27 Event: Throw-in by Real Madrid
40:37 Event: Goal by Real Madrid
40:54 Caption: Marcelo (Real Madrid) collects a sweet pass and fires a low shot into the bottom right corner, leaving the keeper helpless.
41:54 Event: Kick-off by Valencia
42:52 Caption: Casemiro (Real Madrid) tries his luck with a shot from long range, but his effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
43:05 Event: Ball out of play
43:17 Event: Substitution by Valencia
43:47 Caption: Voro has decided to make a change. Zakaria Bakkali (Valencia) replaces Fabian Orellana.
44:45 Event: Ball out of play
45:09 Event: Throw-in by Real Madrid
45:17 Caption: Alvaro Morata (Real Madrid) attempts to find Daniel Carvajal, but puts far too much on the pass and the chance is gone.
45:20 Event: Ball out of play
45:24 Event: Throw-in by Real Madrid
45:46 Caption: Marco Asensio (Real Madrid) couldn't beat the offside trap and the flag goes up. The assistant referee quickly made a difficult call as it was a really tight offside.
46:17 Event: Ball out of play
46:39 Event: Corner by Valencia
46:47 Caption: Daniel Parejo (Valencia) takes the corner kick, but Keylor Navas reads it well and stops the effort.
47:12 Event: Ball out of play
47:15 Caption: The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Lucas (Real Madrid) will replace Luka Modric.
47:51 Event: Substitution by Real Madrid
48:01 Event: Throw-in by Valencia
48:24 Event: Foul by Valencia
48:45 Caption: Ezequiel Garay (Valencia) was too fierce in his attempt to get the ball from his opponent and Jesus Gil Manzano blows for a foul.
48:59 Caption: The referee blows for the end of today's match.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Real Madrid faced off against Valencia in an exhilarating encounter that kept fans on the edge of their seats at the Santiago Bernabéu. The atmosphere was electrifying right from the start as Real Madrid kicked off proceedings. Within the first minute, the intensity was palpable, evident by an early foul committed by Real Madrid. Valencia quickly took their chances too, registering a shot on target and another just off target within the first minute. The frequent interruptions for throw-ins and corners peppered the early part of the game, reflecting the high stakes and energy levels on both sides.

Shortly after the match began, Karim Benzema found himself in action. He attempted a header from the penalty spot, showing early signs of Real Madrid’s offensive intent. However, Valencia's goalkeeper, Diego Alves, remained resolute, making a comfortable save. Just after, Benzema was flagged offside, highlighting the tight defensive discipline from Valencia.

Valencia were not without their opportunities either. Nani delivered a dangerous cross into the box, cleared by Real Madrid's alert defence. Fabian Orellana came very close to breaking the deadlock, as he received a pass on the edge of the box but shot just wide of the right post.

The duel's physical nature was evident with frequent fouls from both sides. Valencia's Daniel Parejo received a yellow card for a clumsy tackle, followed by Antonio Latorre Grueso also getting booked for a harsh challenge. Real Madrid managed their first clear break when Dani Carvajal sent in a beautiful cross to Cristiano Ronaldo, who rose majestically to place a bullet header into the bottom left corner, sending the stadium into rapture. Real Madrid took the lead at 1:0.

Valencia attempted to respond quickly, managing a free-kick situation but failing as Parejo’s shot hit the defensive wall, culminating in a routine catch for Keylor Navas. Real Madrid kept up the pressure, and Benzema was in the thick of the action again, unleashing a powerful strike that was brilliantly saved by Alves. Despite notable efforts from James Rodriguez and other midfield maestros like Toni Kroos producing goal-scoring opportunities, misfired shots and Valencia’s resolute defence kept the scoreline unchanged leading into halftime.

The second half commenced with Valencia eager to equalize. The physicality resumed as Real Madrid committed early fouls. Amid several wasted opportunities, Casemiro picked up a yellow card for holding his opponent, halting a promising attack from Valencia. Not long after, Valencia seized an opportunity when the referee awarded them an indirect free kick. However, Nani’s shot from the rebound inside the box went wide.

Real Madrid continued to assert their dominance, with several attempts at goal. Benzema came agonizingly close when his shot bounced off the right post. An exhilarating moment ensued when Real Madrid were awarded a penalty after a forceful tackle by Daniel Parejo inside the box. Cristiano Ronaldo stepped up but was denied by another superb save from Diego Alves, keeping Valencia's hopes alive.

Valencia pushed harder, and substitutions came into play, with Rodrigo replacing Nani to freshen up their attacking options. An opportunity presented itself soon after with Rodrigo blasting the ball just wide of the right post from the edge of the box. Real Madrid too looked to the bench for inspiration, swapping Benzema for Alvaro Morata.

As the second half progressed, Real Madrid continued to probe Valencia's defence. Modric and Morata found themselves in the referee's book for aggressive tackles. Out of nowhere, Valencia got their breakthrough. A spectacular free-kick by Daniel Parejo from long range saw the ball nestle into the top left corner, bringing the score to 1-1 and signaling a grandstand finish to the match.

The game was far from over as Real Madrid immediately intensified their offensive efforts. Marcelo, having received a sweet pass, fired a low shot into the bottom right corner, restoring Real Madrid's lead at 2:1. Valencia made another substitution, bringing in Jose Gaya to replace the injured Antonio Latorre Grueso as both teams geared up for the final push.

Casemiro attempted a long-range shot that was blocked by Valencia’s defenders. Another crucial change saw Lucas replace Modric for Real Madrid, providing fresh legs in their midfield. Numerous throw-ins, and a missed header by Cristiano Ronaldo as he sent the ball narrowly over the crossbar, amplified the tension. Late substitutions for Valencia included Zakaria Bakkali replacing Fabian Orellana, underlining their continuous attempts to change the dynamics on the pitch.

As the clock ticked down, the frantic pace did not wane. Despite Real Madrid’s defensive resilience blocking several shots and clearing potential threats, each team's desperate search for another goal made for a riveting climax. The referee's final whistle brought an end to an intense and captivating match, confirming Real Madrid's 2-1 victory over a valiant Valencia side.

This match underlined Real Madrid's grit, the clever playmaking from their midfield, and the heroic goalkeeping by Diego Alves who kept Valencia in contention till the very end. The tactical adjustments, the on-field rivalries, and the sheer determination showcased by both teams made this encounter an unforgettable one in the annals of La Liga. The game served as a concrete reminder of the unpredictable and exhilarating nature of football, where fortunes can switch in a heartbeat and every moment is fraught with possibilities.
